articles.title: Taiwan implements mask-rationing system amid Wuhan virus outbreak | AFP - AFP News Agency
articles.description: Taiwan has implemented rationing for surgical face masks after the Wuhan coronavirus caused acute shortages. Two masks per person per week can be bought at g...
articles.content:
Taiwan has implemented rationing for surgical face masks after the Wuhan coronavirus caused acute shortages. Two masks per person per week can be bought at government registered pharmacies across the island at a cost of NT$5 (US$0.16) each.

articles.title: Cave full of bats in China identified as source of virus almost identical to the one killing hundreds today - National Post
articles.description: Researchers discovered the cave 15 years ago but did not have funding for further research on a virus 96 per cent similar to the novel coronavirus
articles.content:
Fifteen years ago, scientists discovered a cave in southern China that held viruses almost identical to the one that has killed nearly 500 people today and the ones that caused the SARS and MERS outbreaks decades ago. 
The cave, whose exact location is being… [+7548 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Chinese doctor Li Wenliang, who sounded the alarm on coronavirus, is in critical condition - CBS News
articles.description: Dr. Li Wenliang, who was threatened by Chinese officials after warning fellow clinicians of the virus in December, died Thursday of coronavirus.

articles.title: Antiviral cubano es utilizado en China para contrarrestar el coronavirus - CubaDebate
articles.description: El antiviral Interferón alfa 2B recombinante (IFNrec), un producto líder de la biotecnología de Cuba, es uno de los medicamentos usados por China en los tratamientos aplicados a enfermos de la epidemia coronavirus 2019-nCoV. Desde el 25 de enero, la planta mi…
articles.content:
El medicamento cubano es un antiviral y se utiliza para combatir infecciones respiratorias producidas por el VIH.Foto: Presidencia Cuba.

articles.title: Coronavirus, giovani a rischio “psicosi”: 1 su 4 evita ristoranti e negozi cinesi - TGCOM
articles.description: Il rischio psicosi è dietro l'angolo: più di 1 su 3 guarda con maggiore sospetto le persone cinesi in viaggio in Italia, il 18% teme il contatto con i compagni di classe originari del Paese asiatico.
articles.content: La maggior parte di loro, infatti, è a conoscenza dei principali sintomi della malattia. Questo nonostante la fonte d’informazione primaria siano i social network, luogo naturale d’attracco di fake news e allarmismi incontrollati. Nozioni di base che, però, n… [+2509 chars]
